page.title: 06ORIGINS/CHURCHES
page.content: {ORIGINS Danehill (originally Denhill) means 'pig hill'. The pigs were brought hee to feed on the acorns in the forest and gradually a settlement grew up. As the turnpike roads came to Sussex it got bigger and with the advent of railways it became a dormitory town. {CHURCHES} 2 of the 7 churches are disused. In 1835 the first Danehill church was built which stood on the site of the war memorial. The present church was built in 1893 on the orders of Mr Herbert Carey Hardy's wife on his death from an operation on his broken leg and his tomb is now behind the war memorial. Danehill church is probably the only church in the world on the Greenwich Meridian.
